title: NASA Funds Projects that Aim to Inspire Artemis Generation
summary: NASA has selected a variety of projects that take innovative approaches to broadening student participation in science, technology, engineering, and math to receive awards totaling approximately $12.5 million.

title: NASA to buy five additional Crew Dragon flights
summary: NASA is planning to purchase five more Crew Dragon missions to the International Space Station from SpaceX, a move the agency says is needed to ensure long-term access to the station.

title: NASA Selects New Instruments for Priority Artemis Science on Moon
summary: Adding to the growing list of commercial deliveries slated to explore more of the Moon than ever before under Artemis, NASA has selected two new science instrument suites, including one that will study the mysterious Gruithuisen Domes for the first time.

title: NASA Invites Media to Headquarters to Meet Commercial Crew Astronauts
summary: NASA will host an in-person media opportunity at 8:45 a.m. EDT Tuesday, June 7, at NASA Headquarters in Washington with the agency’s SpaceX Crew-2 astronauts to discuss their recent mission aboard the International Space Station to benefit life on Earth and further exploration.

title: Lockheed and ABL’s first UK vertical launch slips into 2023
summary: Lockheed Martin no longer expects its UK Pathfinder mission will fly this year, although it remains in the running to perform the first-ever vertical launch to orbit from British soil.

title: GAO: U.S. Space Command basing decision process fell short on ‘transparency and credibility’
summary: GAO in a June 2 report said the Air Force’s basing selection process for U.S. Space Command lacked transparency and credibility.

title: How Lockheed Martin, NASA will send a rocket to Mars to launch samples off the planet to a waiting European Orbiter
summary: It’s an ask never before attempted: Launch samples off the surface of another planet for return to Earth — using a rocket you first have to launch from Earth using a bigger rocket and then land on Mars.

title: After 9 difficult months, Firefly is set to take its next shot at orbit
summary: The launch company is targeting mid-July for Alpha's next launch.

title: Long March 2C launches 9 navigation test satellites for Chinese automaker
summary: A Long March 2C launched nine positioning and connectivity test satellites early Thursday, in a first step for a constellation to support autonomous driving for automaker Geely.

title: Momentus attempting to fix anomalies with first Vigoride tug
summary: A week after the launch of its first space tug, Momentus is still dealing with “anomalies” with the vehicle, but the company’s chief executive remains optimistic those issues will be resolved.
